SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

sif3.infra.rest.client
Class ClientInterface

java.lang.Object
  sif3.infra.rest.client.ClientInterface

public class ClientInterface
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a core client class to deal with REST clients for SIF3. It takes care of all the little things that define the SIF3 REST transport for all the operations stated in the SIF3 spec. It abstracts the finer details on how a URL is constructed, what header fields are required on the request as well as the response. It takes all of this internal processing and SIF3 infrastructure management away from the higher levels of this framework.

Each client call must use this class to ensure that all the things that make a SIF3 REST call valid are guaranteed.

Note:
This class is the REST Client Implementation. Even though it is called 'Interface' it is not a proper interface. There is a possibility that later versions of this framework will rename this class but since it is fully abstracted in the lower levels of this framework and not exposed to the higher levels such a change will most likely not impact the services written by developers.

Author:
Joerg Huber

Parameters:
baseURI - The base URI of this client. All URIs are for all other calls are relative to this base URL.
mediaType - XML or JSOn are the expected media types. They must be supported by the given marshaller and unmarshaller.
marshaller - Marshaller to marshal the payloads of this client to appropriate representations. This marshaller must be valid for the data model used with this client.
unmarshaller - Unarshaller to unmarshal the payloads of this client to appropriate representations. This unmarshaller must be valid for the data model used with this client.

getSingle

public Response getSingle(java.lang.String relURI,
                          java.lang.String resourceID,
                          TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                          java.lang.Class<?> returnObjectClass,
                          SIFZone zone,
                          SIFContext context)
                   throws ServiceInvokationException
This method will retrieve the object given by its resourceID. This call will invoke the REST GET call. The object will be unmarshalled into the returnObjectClass and be stored as part of the returned Response object. If there are any internal errors then a ServiceInvokationException will be raised and the error is logged.

Parameters:
relURI - A relative URI to the baseURI given to the constructor of this class. It is appended to the baseURI as is.
resourceID - The Id of the object to be returned. If the object doesn't exist the appropriate status is set in the returned Response object as defined by the SIF3 spec.
hdrProperties - Header Properties to be added to the header of the GET request.
returnObjectClass - The class type into which the object shall be unmarshalled into. The final object is stored in the returned Response object.
zone - The zone for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT zone.
context - The context for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT context.
Returns:
The Response to this GET call. See the Response class for details of the content of this object.
Throws:
ServiceInvokationException - An internal error occured. An error is logged.

createSingle

public Response createSingle(java.lang.String relURI,
                             java.lang.Object payload,
                             TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                             java.lang.Class<?> returnObjectClass,
                             SIFZone zone,
                             SIFContext context)
                      throws ServiceInvokationException
Will invoke the REST POST method. Before the call it will marshal the 'payload' into appropriate format (mediaType) and add the 'hdrProperties' to the header of the POST request. If there are any errors then the ServiceInvokationException is raised and the error is logged.

Parameters:
relURI - A relative URI to the baseURI given to the constructor of this class. It is appended to the baseURI as is.
payload - The payload in its object form. The marshaller given in the constructor of this method is used to convert the payload to appropriate format (mediaType).
hdrProperties - Header Properties to be added to the header of the POST request.
returnObjectClass - The class type into which the object shall be unmarshalled into. The final object is stored in the returned Response object.
zone - The zone for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT zone.
context - The context for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT context.
Returns:
Response Object holding appropriate values and results of the call.
Throws:
ServiceInvokationException - Any underlying errors occured such as unable to marshal the object into its mediatype, failure to invoke actual web-service etc.

updateSingle

                             java.lang.String resourceID,
                             java.lang.Object payload,
                             TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                             SIFZone zone,

                      throws ServiceInvokationException
Will invoke the REST PUT method. Before the call it will marshal the 'payload' into appropriate format (mediaType) and add the 'hdrProperties' to the header of the PUT request. If there are any errors then the ServiceInvokationException is raised and the error is logged.

payload - The payload in its object form. The marshaller given in the constructor of this method is used to convert the payload to appropriate format (mediaType).
hdrProperties - Header Properties to be added to the header of the PUT request.
zone - The zone for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT zone.
context - The context for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT context.
Returns:

Throws:
ServiceInvokationException - Any underlying errors occurred such as unable to marshal the object into its media type, failure to invoke actual web-service etc.

                             java.lang.String resourceID,
                             TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                             SIFZone zone,

                      throws ServiceInvokationException

hdrProperties - Header Properties to be added to the header of the DELETE request.
zone - The zone for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT zone.
context - The context for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT context.
Returns:
Response Object holding appropriate values and results of the call.
Throws:
ServiceInvokationException - Any underlying errors occurred such as failure to invoke actual web-service etc.

getMany

public Response getMany(java.lang.String relURI,
                        PagingInfo pagingInfo,
                        TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                        java.lang.Class<?> returnObjectClass,
                        SIFZone zone,
                        SIFContext context)
                 throws ServiceInvokationException
Will invoke the REST GET call (Query). Because no resourceID is provided it will automatically return a list of objects (collection). Additional parameters of this method indicate what part of the collection shall be returned (pagingInfo) as well as what zone and context this query shall apply to.

Parameters:
relURI - A relative URI to the baseURI given to the constructor of this class. It is appended to the baseURI as is.
pagingInfo - Page information to be set for the provider to determine which results to return.
hdrProperties - Header Properties to be added to the header of the GET request.
returnObjectClass - The class type into which the object shall be unmarshalled into. The final object is stored in the returned Response object.
zone - The zone for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT zone.
context - The context for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT context.
Returns:
Response Object holding appropriate values and results of the call.
Throws:
ServiceInvokationException - Any underlying errors occurred such as failure to invoke actual web-service etc.

createMany

public BulkOperationResponse createMany(java.lang.String relURI,
                                        java.lang.Object payload,
                                        TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                                        SIFZone zone,
                                        SIFContext context)
                                 throws ServiceInvokationException
This invokes the REST POST call. This method is used to create many objects in one call as defined by the SIF3 spec. The returned list of responses equate to one response per object in the given payload. The order of the responses is the same as the order in the original payload. The first response in the BulkOperationResponse list is the response to the create of the first object in the payload etc.

Parameters:
relURI - A relative URI to the baseURI given to the constructor of this class. It is appended to the baseURI as is.
payload - The payload in its object form. The marshaller given in the constructor of this method is used to convert the payload to appropriate format (mediaType).
hdrProperties - Header Properties to be added to the header of the POST request.
zone - The zone for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT zone.
context - The context for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT context.
Returns:
Response Object holding appropriate values and results of the call.
Throws:
ServiceInvokationException - Any underlying errors occurred such as failure to invoke actual web-service etc.

updateMany

                                        java.lang.Object payload,
                                        TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                                        SIFZone zone,
                                        SIFContext context)
                                 throws ServiceInvokationException

The returned list of responses equate to one response per object in the given payload. The order of the responses is the same as the order in the original payload. The first response in the BulkOperationResponse list is the response to the create of the first object in the payload etc.

Throws:

removeMany

public BulkOperationResponse removeMany(java.lang.String relURI,
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> resourceIDs,
                                        TransportHeaderProperties hdrProperties,
                                        SIFZone zone,
                                        SIFContext context)
                                 throws ServiceInvokationException
This invokes the REST DELETE call. This method is used to delete many objects in one call as defined by the SIF3 spec. The returned list of responses equate to one response per object in the given payload. The order of the responses is the same as the order in the original payload. The first response in the BulkOperationResponse list is the response to the create of the first object in the payload etc.

There is an issue with java.net.HttpURLConnection where it doesn't allow an payload for the DELETE! So currently the implementation of the removeMany fakes such a behaviour and actually calls individual DELETEs. This is not ideal but until a work around is figured out that is what this method does.

Parameters:
relURI - A relative URI to the baseURI given to the constructor of this class. It is appended to the baseURI as is.
resourceIDs - A list of resourceId for the objects to be deleted.
hdrProperties - Header Properties to be added to the header of the DELETE request.
zone - The zone for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT zone.
context - The context for which this operation shall be invoked. Can be null which indicates the DEFAULT context.
Returns:
Response Object holding appropriate values and results of the call.
Throws:
ServiceInvokationException - Any underlying errors occurred such as failure to invoke actual web-service etc.
